Posted By: Jinx585 (1/17/2010 9:34:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Dark Depths will work.
  
On turn 1 play swamp. On turn 2, play Dark Depths, put 10 ice counters on it. Tap swamp, play 2 dark rituals, 5 black mana total, play Aether Snap, remove all counters from all permanents and tokens (all at same time when card resolves). Dark Depths is a permanent with counters, so they are removed, but there are no tokens to be removed (black avatar isn't on play yet). Aether Snap is buried (it's a sorcery).
  
Dark Depths checks (right after Aether Snap resolved) if it there are no ice counters in Dark Depths. There aren't. It triggers, sacrifices itself, and a 20/20 indestructible flying black avatar is put in game.
  
   
If you play with 4 dark depths, 4 Aether Snaps, 4 dark rituals and 24 swamps, and take the 1st turn (no draw), the probability of having a winning hand by 2nd turn is 44.5% (aether snap) x 45% (dark ritual) x 35.9% (2nd dark ritual) x 46.3% (dark depths) x 99.2% (swamp) = 3,1%
posts.html:
Dark Depths will work.
On turn 1 play swamp. On turn 2, play Dark Depths, put 10 ice counters on it. Tap swamp, play 2 dark rituals, 5 black mana total, play Aether Snap, remove all counters from all permanents and tokens (all at same time when card resolves). Dark Depths is a permanent with counters, so they are removed, but there are no tokens to be removed (black avatar isn't on play yet). Aether Snap is buried (it's a sorcery).
Dark Depths checks (right after Aether Snap resolved) if it there are no ice counters in Dark Depths. There aren't. It triggers, sacrifices itself, and a 20/20 indestructible flying black avatar is put in game.

If you play with 4 dark depths, 4 Aether Snaps, 4 dark rituals and 24 swamps, and take the 1st turn (no draw), the probability of having a winning hand by 2nd turn is 44.5% (aether snap) x 45% (dark ritual) x 35.9% (2nd dark ritual) x 46.3% (dark depths) x 99.2% (swamp) = 3,1%

Posted By: Shadoflaam (11/8/2011 12:00:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As someone who has a fairly old collection and can't afford to buy a lot of cards, who plays against a lot of newer players who have newer collections and lots of planeswalkers, I love this card!
  
   
And it doesn't just work against one deck, it hoses Planeswalkers off the table, sends Allies crying to their mummy, unscrews Modular decks (I have one of those) and beats up those really horrible decks that produce stupid amounts of Elves (I have one of those too).
  
   
Plenty of uses, and even more now that Innistrad is going to have us all up to our eyebrows in Zombies.
posts.html:
